summary: Robert J. Lehner is mentioned in the context of the Assassination Records Review Board's (ARRB) review of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. Specifically, one document refers to the postponed release of his payroll records due to privacy concerns related to Social Security numbers. While the documents indicate that Lehner was an HSCA staff member, the specific nature of his role or contribution to the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination is not detailed within these documents. The documents primarily focus on the ARRB's process of redacting sensitive personal information before releasing the HSCA payroll records.
significance: Robert J. Lehner's significance in the JFK context is limited to his employment with the HSCA. The documents suggest he was a staff member whose payroll records were subject to review and partial postponement of release by the ARRB due to privacy concerns. The specific nature of his work with the HSCA is not detailed in these documents.
